metadata.synopsis: Captain Therezzyn of Creche Yllek interrogates the player about the missing githyanki "weapon". We should learn:1. The githyanki's missing weapon and our artefact are THE SAME2. the githyanki were planning to attack moonrise towers
metadata.how_to_trigger: Get spotted by the captain after the CaptainTemplarDialog finishes.Complete the Zaithisk dialogue to unlock all options.

46.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
46.text: I presume you are not stupid enough to return empty-handed. So give me the weapon - now.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: I've not found it yet - but I'm close. I just need more time.

14.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
14.text: Time is finite. As is my patience. Go.

51.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
51.text: Time is finite. As is my patience. Go.

21.text: Then our ghustil will study your corpse.

74.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
74.text: Then our ghustil will study your corpse.

56.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
56.text: Honoured kith'rak. May Vlaakith show us truth.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Honoured kith'rak. May Vlaakith show us truth.

164.speaker: Lae'zel
164.text: Honoured kith'rak. May Vlaakith show us truth.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: You are not familiar to me, ra'stil. Do you bring news of the weapon?

24.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
24.text: You are not familiar to me, ra'stil. Do you bring news of the weapon?

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Weapon? I seek aid. We should be fighting the ghaik incursion.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Your sentries thought I could be of use to the Inquisitor.

0.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
0.text: Chk. A kith'rak's time is precious. Waste it at your peril.

71.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
71.text: Finish your business here, and leave.

97.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
97.text: You have returned. Any news of the weapon?

16.speaker: Player
16.text: What does this weapon look like?

42.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
42.text: Then squander my time no more. Go. Now.

104.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
104.text: An istik. In my crèche. You are one of the mercenaries sent to bring the weapon?
104.context: NodeContext: Isitk should be spat here, she is disgusted by you

103.speaker: Player
103.text: The istik is with me, honoured kith'rak.

147.speaker: Lae'zel
147.text: The istik is with me, honoured kith'rak.

158.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
158.text: So noted. But my question goes unanswered. Do you bring the weapon?

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I think I have what you're looking for.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I believe I have found the weapon we seek.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I seek audience with your Inquisitor. There's a traitor among you.

99.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
99.text: Chk - a strong accusation from the mouth of an istik. The very same said to hold the weapon we seek.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: That is only for your Inquisitor to know. Take me to him.

44.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
44.text: Chk - vague allegations and undue demands. A poor introduction for an unproven istik.

34.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
34.text: The very same said to hold the weapon we seek.

9.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
9.text: You are forbidden to leave. Report to the Inquisitor at once. Deliver the Prism.

57.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
57.text: Do not try to leave or it will be your death!

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Forgive me - I misspoke. There is no traitor.

28.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
28.text: Then learn to tame your tongue. I will ask one last time: have you brought the weapon?

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I was granted entry by your sentries. They told me to seek the Inquisitor.
77.context: NodeContext: with fatigue - she has tried this argument many times with the inquisitor and failed

72.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
72.context: NodeContext: with fatigue - she has tried this argument many times with the inquisitor and failed

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I'm to report to your infirmary for investigation.
116.context: NodeContext: with fatigue - she has tried this argument many times with the inquisitor and failed

3.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
3.text: Does this look like an infirmary?

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Can you give me a description of the weapon you seek?

151.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
151.text: Our healer's office is past the dormitories. Go, before I send you as a corpse.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I have proof of the illithid invasion - it might help your Inquisitor to rethink his priorities.
32.context: NodeContext: with fatigue - she has tried this argument many times with the inquisitor and failed

135.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
135.text: We have all the proof we need and it has not moved his resolve.
135.context: NodeContext: with fatigue - she has tried this argument many times with the inquisitor and failed

25.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
25.text: Information. Chk. If it's not about the weapon we seek, I don't care.

166.text: I told you, they will stop at nothing to reclaim it.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I know nothing about the weapon.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I need a description of the weapon you seek.
5.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I was told to seek your infirmary.
65.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

163.speaker: Player
163.text: There's a mind flayer invasion in progress. Why is that not your priority?
163.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

27.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
27.text: You are well informed. My crèche discovered the same.
27.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

91.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
91.text: We know infected flock to Moonrise Towers. I reported the gathering masses back to Tu'narath.
91.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

175.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
175.text: In response, they sent an Inquisitor. Instead of ordering an assault, we were told to join in this mad hunt for an ancient relic.
175.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

96.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
96.text: Meanwhile, illithid sickness spreads right in front of us.
96.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

125.speaker: Player
125.text: What is so important about this weapon?

130.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
130.text: I do not know - this hunt is the Inquisitor's folly, not mine.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: What does this weapon look like?

118.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
118.text: Inquisitor W'wargaz has the Queen's ear, so we have no choice but to follow him in this folly.
118.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

63.speaker: Player
63.text: What is so important about this weapon?
63.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

54.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
54.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

43.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
43.text: But I cannot imagine this is what our queen wants.
43.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

111.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
111.text: Still, perhaps you've heard of it. Tell me, does this sound familiar?
111.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

133.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
133.text: It is small. Angular. Metal. Adorned with tir'su script. Stolen by 'True Soul' heretics.
133.context: InternalNodeContext: flag this for knowng what the artefact looks like

144.speaker: Narrator
144.text: *She seeks the artefact you carry - the artefact now nestled in your pocket, that doesn't want to be relinquished.*
144.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

88.speaker: Player
88.text: *You realise she seeks the artefact you carry.*
88.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *You realise she seeks the artefact you carry.*
126.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *You sense Shadowheart's worry. This 'weapon' sounds like the artefact you carry.*
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart looks at the player, deeply worried.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: What was that look? You know something. Do you have it?
85.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

124.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
124.text: What was that look? You know something. Do you have it?
124.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I have what you're looking for.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I have found the weapon we seek.
20.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

174.speaker: Player
174.text: I sincerely hope you know what you're doing...
174.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: I sincerely hope you know what you're doing...
106.context: NodeContext: A whispered, worried exclamation from Shadowheart, she's terrified

141.speaker: Player
141.text: Ch'mar zal'a Vlaakith! Give it to me.
141.context: NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith - means 'Vlaakith's will above all' - used in the way that we may say 'Praise the Lord!'

152.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
152.text: Ch'mar zal'a Vlaakith! Give it to me.
152.context: NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith - means 'Vlaakith's will above all' - used in the way that we may say 'Praise the Lord!'

95.speaker: Player
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player produces the artefact.

55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player produces the artefact.

62.text: Yes - there it is. Exactly as described. The inquisition will finally come to an end.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: The captain moves her hand, psionic energy gathering. She closes her fist and pulls towards her. The artefact is pulled to the captain. She holds it suspended in the air with her psionics. It begins to glow

129.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
129.text: Yes - there it is. Exactly as described. The inquisition will finally come to an end.
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Therezzyn studies the artefact suspended before her.

60.text: Tsk'va! Trickery, heresy, how did you -
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: The artefact's glow pulses into a shockwave of energy, blasting the captain off her feet and propelling the artefact back to the player. The player picks it up.

110.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
110.text: Tsk'va! Trickery, heresy, how did you -
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: The captain scrambles to her feet after being knocked down by a blast from the artefact NodeContext: she gets into an angry rant and then rights herself, reallising it's not worth it

79.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
79.text: You manipulate it when I cannot?
79.context: NodeContext: bitter, envious, a bit sarcastic

78.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
78.text: It appears you have been chosen, istik. You are lucky it is not for me to question why.
78.context: NodeContext: bitter, envious, a bit sarcastic

114.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
114.text: Go, seek the Inquisitor below. And take the cursed thing with you.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: The captain begins to walk towards the barrier device.

156.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
156.text: No? Then I will take it from your corpse.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I don't know anything about it.
123.context: InternalNodeContext: BarrierDeactivated state flag on here temporarily until new scripting is submitted.

136.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
136.text: Then why, ra'stil, do you waste my time?

112.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
112.text: Then stop wasting my time, istik.

171.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
171.text: By command of the Inquisition, you are ordered to join in our search. Return with the weapon, or do not return at all.

139.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
139.text: You are one of the mercenaries we engaged, are you not?

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Of course. I will be back on the search immediately.

1.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
1.text: A fortune in gold, vouched for by our queen herself.

87.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
87.text: I have business to attend to. Return with the weapon, or do not return at all.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Not exactly. I'm here to loot the place.

138.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
138.text: You are here to - no. You are here to die.

161.text: And yet your face betrays you. You found it, didn't you?

69.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
69.text: And yet your face betrays you. You found it, didn't you?

162.speaker: Player
162.text: What I know can only be heard by the Inquisitor. You must let me pass.
162.context: InternalNodeContext: BarrierDeactivated state flag on here temporarily until new scripting is submitted.

165.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
165.text: If you speak truth, the Inquisitor will reward you greatly. If you lie...
165.context: InternalNodeContext: BarrierDeactivated state flag on here temporarily until new scripting is submitted.

37.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
37.text: If you speak truth, the Inquisitor will reward you greatly. If you lie...
37.context: InternalNodeContext: BarrierDeactivated state flag on here temporarily until new scripting is submitted.

75.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
75.text: ...Well. Inquisitor W'wargaz will ensure you do not bother me again.
75.context: InternalNodeContext: BarrierDeactivated state flag on here temporarily until new scripting is submitted.

23.text: You would invoke rank? On a kith'rak? Pathetic, vin'iisk.

17.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
17.text: You would invoke rank? On a kith'rak? Pathetic, vin'iisk.

6.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
6.text: Only return if you have the weapon. I will not tolerate insubordination.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: If the Inquisition seeks this weapon, it must be vital. Tell me of it.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Maybe I can help you find the weapon.

176.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
176.text: Tell me, istik, does this sound familiar?

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I am no mercenary, but I am a good tracker. Describe the weapon - I can help you.
107.context: NodeContext: superior, rude, insulting humans for being human

31.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
31.text: Arrogance - a typical symptom of the istik condition. But an arrogant tracker is a tracker nonetheless.
31.context: NodeContext: superior, rude, insulting humans for being human

168.speaker: Player
168.text: To value a mere weapon so much is pure vanity. You should worry more about your warriors.

22.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
22.text: You are mistaken. The hunt for the weapon is the Inquisitor's folly, not mine - but it is not your place to question orders.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Sure I have a weapon. Want to see your blood on it?

145.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
145.text: I'll gladly see you try. Htak'a!

134.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
134.text: Using my room as a thoroughfare is an indignity. Disturbing me is an insult. Begone.
134.context: InternalNodeContext: 'him' is the Inquisitor. Captain doesn't know he's dead. NodeContext: with a hint of jealousy - she's not managed to impress the inquisitor yet

140.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
140.text: You must have impressed him, to be let out so readily.
140.context: InternalNodeContext: 'him' is the Inquisitor. Captain doesn't know he's dead. NodeContext: with a hint of jealousy - she's not managed to impress the inquisitor yet

153.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
153.text: You have orders. See them done.
153.context: InternalNodeContext: She doesn't like that you've got more important things to do than she does. NodeContext: slightly sulky
